clinical_study.brief_title: Liver Function Assessment - Feasibility and Dosing Study
clinical_study.official_title: A Feasibility Study to Determine an Adequate Dose of ICG for the Liver Function Assessment System in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to 1) determine the feasibility of using Cardiox Liver Function Assessment System (LFA) to measure indocyanine green (ICG) clearance; 2) determine an adequate dose based on LFA technology and 3) determine an adequate time period for LFA determination.

detailed_description.textblock: Four cohorts of subjects will be enrolled. The fist two cohorts will receive fixed doses of ICG dye (2.5 mg, 5.0 mg, 7.5 mg, 10.0 mg) followed by 20 minutes of LFT monitoring. The final two cohorts will receive weight based doses of ICG dye (0.1 mg/kg, 0.5 mg/kg) followed by 20 minutes of LFT monitoring. Additionally the final two cohorts will have serial blood draws before the ICG dose and at 5, 10, 15 and 20 minutes post ICG dose.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Business decision to discontinue product development.

primary_outcome.measure: ICG dye detection using the LFT system compared to serial blood sampling ethods.
primary_outcome.description: Determination of an adequate dose for the Cardiox Liver Functioning Assessment LFA system to produce liver function assessments consistent with serial blood sampling methods.

secondary_outcome.measure: ICG fluorescence detection at the scaphoid fossa of the ears
Repeatability of the Cardiox LFA system to detect the ICG fluorescence in the same subjects over time.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female subjects, aged 18 to 75 years, inclusive
- Informed consent documentation understood and signed.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known allergy or sensitivity to the ICG or to iodide contrast dye
- Pregnant women or those nursing babies
